bootId.description: The boot id for this alarm in the device if alarm is a device alarm.

description.example: NTP service initiated. Synchronization state is unknown.
description.description: The text representation of this alarm

isCleared.description: This flag shows if the alarm is already cleared.

sequenceNumber.description: The sequence number for this alarm in the device if alarm is a device alarm.

mute.description: Flag to specify if you want to mute/unmute the notifications.

acknowledgedBy.description: The user who acknowledged this alarm.

alarmTypeQualifier.description: Unique qualifier for an alarm. It could be null if the alarm id is enough to distinguish the alarms

altComponent.description: Used if the alarming resource is available over other interfaces.

bootId.description: The boot id for this alarm in the device if alarm is a device alarm.

component.description: The component which raised this alarm.

description.description: The text representation of this alarm

isCleared.description: This flag shows if the alarm is already cleared.

isResolved.description: This flag shows if the alarm is already marked as resolved by the customer.

resolvedBy.description: The user who moved this alert to resolved.

sequenceNumber.description: The sequence number for this alarm in the device if alarm is a device alarm.

where.description: Hostname, site, etc where this alarm is generated for.

items.description: List of users that have acknowledged the alert

acknowledgementReason.description: Reason put by users when acknowledged

allowListed.description: whether entity in alert is put in allowlist/excludelist, disabling alert (required)

descendantPresent.description: Whether or not descendants are present (required)

deviceId.description: Internal device id to navigate to troubleshooting

endTime.description: When this alert was last seen as a continuation (required)

enterpriseId.description: Internal enterprise id to navigate to troubleshooting (required)

entity.description: Entity that triggered the alert. Edge, core, etc. (required)

muteListed.description: whether entity in alert is put in notification mutelist (required)

notificationCreated.description: whether notification exists for this rule (required)

occurrences.description: Number of times alert was raised as a continuation (required)

plane.description: Plane of the rule generating the alert (required)

ruleId.description: Unique id of the rule generating the alert (required)

severity.description: Severity of the rule behind the alert (required)

siteId.description: Internal site id to navigate to troubleshooting

startTime.description: When this alert was first triggered (required)

status.description: Status of the alert whether active or inactive (required)

troubleshootingDisabledReason.description: Reason to not navigate to troubleshooting

troubleshootingEnabled.description: Navigate or not navigate to troubleshooting dashboard (required)

alertId.description: Alert id of the parent alert (required)

alertType.description: Type of the alert underlying the notification (required)

name.description: Name given to the notification record (required)

notificationId.description: Unique id for the notification record (required)

ruleId.description: The id of the rule on which notification is created (required)

timesTriggered.description: Number of times notification was triggered for the same alert (required)

frequency.description: Frequency of notifying a continuing alert (required)

messageBody.description: Message body to prepend to actual message

enabled.description: Whether the rule is enabled or disabled (required)

priority.description: Priority of taking action against the rule (required)

items.description: List of notification ids to update (required)

enable.description: Enable or disable. True means enable (required)

items.description: List of notification ids to enable disable (required)
List of notification ids to delete notification records (required)

updatedBy.description: ID of the user who updated the integration

enable.description: Enable or disable. True means enable (required)

items.description: Multiple values are treated as OR

diff.description: The diff of latest and staged configurations in JSON patch format.

hopStatsCount.description: Per hop probes needed for traceroute hop stats

payloadSize.description: Size of  packet to be sent

prefix.description: IPv4 or IPv6 longest matching prefix (required)

hard.description: BGP process restarts if set to true. if false, BGP route is only relearned

localInterface.description: The local interface over which this route is learned

minPingTime.description: Min Ping Time in milli seconds (required)

historyLength.description: Number of most recent speedtest records to return for a specific device (required)

reportId.description: 8 bytes (base32 encoded) identifier for the report

duration.description: Packet capture duration. Accepted values are 30, 60, 180 (required)

protocol.description: Filters the packet capture for the specified protocol

port.description: Filters the capture for the specified port

prefix.description: Filters the capture for the specified prefix

groupId.description: Only supply if enterprise uses an idp

currentPage.description: The page number we are currently on (required)

endCursor.description: Cursor pointing to the last record on the current page

hasNextPage.description: An indicator whether there is a page after this one in the resultset based on current position

hasPrevPage.description: An indicator whether there is a page before this one in the resultset based on current position

startCursor.description: Cursor pointing to the first record on the current page

totalPages.description: The number of pages in the complete resultset based on the current length of the page (required)

totalRecords.description: Describes the total number of records in the complete resultset (required)

bucketSizeSec.description: the size of the time window in seconds (required)

ulBw.description: Bandwidth in kilo bits per second

slaClass.description: SLA class is specified if queue apps utilization data is desired. Circuit name must be provided.

ulUsage.description: Up link application usage in MB

totalConsumedCredits.description: All credits consumed over the entirety the enterprise's contracts

totalContractedCredits.description: Number of credits agreed upon for the entirety of the current contract

totalRemainingCredits.description: Number of unused credits remaining under the current contract

allocatedMonthlyCredits.description: Credits allocated for the current month

consumedMonthlyCredits.description: Credits billed for the current month. It equals the the higher value between the credits allocated and used for the month

priorAllocatedMonthlyCredits.description: Credits allocated for the prior month

priorConsumedMonthlyCredits.description: Credits billed for the prior month.

recommendedMonthlyCredits.description: Expected amount of credits to allocate for the month to match the overall contracted amount. For monthly-contracted enterprises, this is equivalent to the monthly number of credits being billed while for term-based-contracted enterprises, this is equivalent to the number of credits to use up in this and the following months to use up exactly the number of credits remaining in the contract.

consumedCredits.description: Credits billed for the region. It equals the higher value between total credits allocated and used plus any additional dia consumption

coreConversionFactor.description: Conversion rate from gigabytes per second to Graphiant credits used for calculating credits on core networks for this region

gwConversionFactor.description: Conversion rate from gigabytes per second to Graphiant credits used for calculating credits on core networks for this region

combinedCredits.description: Sum of the credits associated with cloud and gateway networks

coreBandwidth.description: Soft-upper-bounded max speed in gigabytes per second associated with core network connections

coreCredits.description: Credits derived from bandwidth on core network connections

gwBandwidth.description: Soft-upper-bounded max speed in gigabytes per second associated with gateway connections

gwCredits.description: Credits derived from bandwidth on gateway network connections

internetBandwidth.description: Bandwidth value associated with dia gateways. This should either be 0, 10, or 100.

internetCredits.description: Additional credits to support the provided DIA bandwidth

allocationUpperBound.description: Int32 value indicating the conversion rates apply from the prior highest upper bound to this upper bound

coreConversionFactor.description: Conversion rate from gigabytes per second to Graphiant credits for connections to core devices

gwConversionFactor.description: Conversion rate from gigabytes per second to Graphiant credits for connections to gateway devices

isPrivate.description: True-only flag indicating the conversion rates apply within a private context such as in-country

allocationCore.description: Gigabytes per second allowed for core network connections on this region

allocationGw.description: Gigabytes per second allowed for gateway connections on this region

allocationInternet.description: Gigabytes per second allowed for dia gateway internet access on this region. Must be 0, 10, or 100

contractedCredits.description: Amount of credits billed for a contract term or monthly if no expiration date is provided

post.description: Returns connectivity status for a b2b peering service. Provides overall service connectivity status and detailed status for producer and customer prefixes for each consumer of the serviceShows whether the service is healthy, impaired, or down, and lists any missing prefixes in Impaired state.
Get the device topology

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the id associated with an entity - consumer_id for consumer, and service_id for the producer/service

parameters.name: isProvider
parameters.description: whether the entity is a provider or consumer

get.description: Returns a list of Site-to-ServerIPAddress statuses for a particular producer of consumer. Each element contains a Site object (with site information) and a mapping of Server Ip addresses to the corresponding Reachability status.Healthy status indicates all the edges/gateways within the Site can reach all the Server IP addresses.Impaired status indicates that some of the edges/gateways within the Site can reach only a subset of Server IP addresses.Down status indicates that none of the edges/gateways within the Site can reach any of the Server IP addresses.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the id associated with an entity - consumer_id for consumer, and service_id for the producer/service

parameters.name: isProvider
parameters.description: whether the entity is a provider or consumer

get.description: Returns a list of Status objects indicating the availability/reachability of all the Server IP addresses configured to the service. Healthy status indicates the Server IP address is reachable from all provider sites. Impaired status indicates the Server IP address is reachable from a subset of provider sites. Down status indicates the Server IP address can't be reached from any of the provider sites.

post.description: Returns connectivity logs for service monitoring. Includes timestamps for when connectivity from an edge/gateway to a Server IP address was lost or regained.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the id associated with an entity - consumer_id for consumer, and service_id for the producer/service

parameters.name: isProvider
parameters.description: whether the entity is a provider or consumer

get.description: Returns connectivity status for individual edges/gateways in extranet/ b2b application service monitoring. Provides granular view of which specific edges can reach server IP addresses. Shows per-edge connectivity status including healthy, impaired, or down states. Helps identify specific edge-level connectivity issues within sites.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the id associated with an entity - consumer_id for consumer, and service_id for the producer/service

parameters.name: isProvider
parameters.description: whether the entity is a provider or consumer

get.description: Detailed view of the reachability of the Server IP addresses from the selected (producer or consumer) Site.Lists Site-to-ServerIPAddress statuses for the selected SiteLists Edge-to-ServerIPAddress statuses for All Edges within the selected Site.Returns physical Location of the SiteReturns Region of the Site.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the id associated with an entity - consumer_id for consumer, and service_id for the producer/service

parameters.name: isProvider
parameters.description: whether the entity is a provider or consumer

get.description: Returns a list of Statuses objects indicating the availability/reachability of the Server IP addresses from the Sites configured to the Provider or Consumer of the service.Healthy status indicates the Site can reach all the Server IP Addresses.Impaired status indicates that the Site can reach only a subset of Server IP addresses.Down status indicates the Site can reach none of the Server IP addresses.
